intro: Zigadenus fuscatus, commonly known as the death bloom, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant contains toxic alkaloids, making it highly poisonous to both humans and animals. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush habitats. Due to its toxicity, it is important to avoid contact with any part of the plant.
